intro: Arachnothryx thiemei, commonly known as the Thieme's arachnothryx, is a rare tropical tree native to the Amazon Basin. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant has a woody stem with a smooth, greyish-brown bark. Its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
